alert.note: Alert for City of Hyder (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 23 at 9:46PM AKST until February 25 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SNOW BEGINNING THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY... .A strengthening low with embedded waves and an associated front will move over the panhandle Friday. Dry snow will spread from north to south across the panhandle. The snow will largely fall in two separate waves. A first, and weaker, wave will move through by early Friday morning. A brief lull may be possible Friday morning for some locations before a much stronger wave moves into the panhandle, bringing with it substantially more snow. Some uncertainty exists regarding snow totals due to limited moisture available, particularly for parts of the northern and central inner channels. For most areas the greatest snowfall rates will be Friday evening through early Saturday morning. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM FRIDAY TO 3 PM AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 11 to 14 inches. * WHERE...City of Hyder. * WHEN...From 3 PM Friday to 3 PM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow is expected to be dry with greatest rates Friday night.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
